## Checklist

<!-- Mark completed items with an "x" -->

### Code Quality

- [ ] My code follows the WordPress coding standards
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings or errors
- [ ] I have checked for potential security vulnerabilities

### Documentation

- [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly (README.md, inline comments)
- [ ] I have updated the CHANGELOG.md (if applicable)
- [ ] I have added/updated PHPDoc comments for new/modified functions

### Testing

- [ ] I have tested my changes thoroughly
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works (if applicable)
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] I have tested for backwards compatibility

### Security

- [ ] I have verified that my changes don't introduce security vulnerabilities
- [ ] I have properly escaped all output
- [ ] I have sanitized all input
- [ ] I have used prepared statements for database queries
- [ ] I have included nonce verification for forms/AJAX requests (if applicable)

### WordPress Best Practices

- [ ] I have used WordPress core functions where available
- [ ] I have properly prefixed function names and global variables
- [ ] I have properly internationalized strings (i18n)
- [ ] I have checked database query performance
